{{Refimprove|date=November 2010}} {{Infobox shopping mall | | shopping_mall_name = SM City Naga | image = SM Supermalls Logo.png | image_width = 200px | caption = ''"We've got it all for you"''
''"First class shopping experience"'' | location = Ninoy and Cory Aquino Avenue, Central Business District II, Brgy. Triangulo, Naga City, Camarines Sur, Philippines | opening_date = May 1, 2009 | developer = [[SM Prime Holdings]] | manager = [[SM Prime Holdings]] | owner = [[Henry Sy|Henry Sy, Sr.]] | gross income = | location for = mall shows, album launches, flagship stores and premiere nights. | number_of_buildings = 2 (main mall and carpark) | architect = Jose Siao Ling & Associates | number_of_stores = | number_of_anchors = | floor_area = 87,959 sq m [http://www.smprime.com/smprime/index.php?p=587&type=2&sec=49&aid=3172] | parking = 2000 cars / 4 levels | slogan = '''We've got it all for you!''' | floors = 2 | website = [http://smsupermalls.com/smsupermalls/index.php?p=651&mall=35 SM City Naga Official Website] }} '''SM City Naga''' is a shopping mall owned and operated by SM Prime Holdings, the largest mall owner and operator in the Philippines. The mall is located in CBD II, Brgy. Triangulo, Naga City, Camarines Sur, Philippines. It is the first SM Supermall in the Bicol Region and the first [[SM Supermall]] to open this 2009. The mall opened the doors to the public last May 1, 2009, and in 2011 the new facade changed the logo of SM City Naga from old one to new one. == Major Anchors == *[[SM Department Store]] *SM Supermarket *SM Cinemas(4) *SM Food Court *SM Appliance Center *Cyberzone == Gallery == Image:SMNAGA1.JPG|SM City Naga nears completion. Opening in 2009. Image:SMNAGA2.JPG|The nearly-completed SM City Naga seen upon entering the CBD II from the National Highway. Image:SMNaga Wide1.jpg|Panoramic view of the nearly-completed, SM City Naga. Image:SMNaga Wide2.jpg|Another panoramic view of the near-completed, SM City Naga. Image:SMNaga Wide Carpark.jpg|This is the 4-level carpark located at the back of the new SM City Naga. [http://www.google.com.ph/images?hl=en&q=sm+city+naga&um=1&ie=UTF-8&source=og&sa=N&tab=wi&biw=1280&bih=468|See More Gallery] == References ==
